column1: Yelabuga (alternative spelling that reflects the Cyrillic spelling: Elabuga; Russian: Ела́буга; Tatar: Алабуга) is a town in the Republic of Tatarstan
column3: located on the right bank of the Kama River and 200 kilometers (120 mi) east from Kazan. Population: 70

column1: The former name of the city was Alabuga. Its history dates back to the 10th century
column2: when a Volga Bulgarian border castle
column3: the so-called Alamir-Sultan castle was built by Bulgar Khan Ibrahim in 985 CE. The castle was built on the place of the legendary tomb of Alamir-Sultan (Alexander the Great "Macedonian"). The name 'Alabuga' originally referred to the tower of the castle
column4: later the whole city was named Alabuga. The castle was later abandoned
column5: and its remains are now known as Şaytan qalası (Shaytan's castle). In the second half of the 16th century
column6: a Russian village was founded on the same spot.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Yelabuga serves as the administrative center of Yelabuzhsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column5: together with the selo of Tarlovka
column6: incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Yelabuga—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: the town of republic significance of Yelabuga is incorporated within Yelabuzhsky Municipal District as Yelabuga Urban Settlement.

column1: Oil industry is present in the town. In the 1990s
column2: a Ford assembly plant operated in the town. In 2008
column3: Sollers JSC built a new factory to produce the Fiat Ducato. There is also a factory for the production of household appliances: domestic oil electric heaters
column4: electric meat grinders Italian group De'Longhi.

column1: Public transportation needs are served by a bus and taxi networks. Plans for a trolleybus route are being discussed.
The town is the birthplace of painter Ivan Shishkin. Nadezhda Durova
column4: was a highly decorated cavalry officer during the Napoleonic Wars died there in 1866.  It is also where the Russian poet Marina Tsvetayeva committed suicide in 1941. The poet is buried at the municipal cemetery.
